subject: Mental Health
title: The Nervous System and Anxiety
description: A fast breakdown of The Nervous System and Anxiety for builders.

hook.text: Your body has two modes: fight-or-flight and rest-and-digest.

buildup.text: The sympathetic nervous system revs you up when danger appears.

discovery.text: The parasympathetic system calms you down once the threat passes.

twist.text: In chronic anxiety, the brake system is weak and the gas pedal is stuck.

climax.text: This imbalance explains why anxious people can't just will themselves to relax.

punchline.text: The engine is racing but the brakes are worn.

quiz.question: Which system calms the body after a threat passes?
